title: Natur
description: nature, nature, natural state, nature, constitution, nature, nature. Learn more in the Cambridge German-English Dictionary.
cleaned_text: Translation of Natur - German-English dictionary Natur [GLOBAL © K | PASSWORD German-English Dictionary Natur noun [nature](/dictionary/english-german/nature)[noun] the physical world, eg trees, plants, animals, mountains, rivers etc, or the power which made them the beauty of nature the forces of nature the study of nature. (Translation of Natur from the [PASSWORD German-English Dictionary](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/german-english/) Verfassung betreffen.|| | If there are going to be changes they should only be small, detailed and technical changes to the constitution. Sollte es Verfassung betreffen. If there are going to be changes they should only be small, detailed and technical changes to the constitution. |Die Problematik der Importe, diesbezüglich ein Kernstück.|| | The problem of imports, be they of a contractual or legislative nature, is a crucial element in this respect. Die Problematik der Importe, sei sie vertraglicher oder gesetzlicher Natur, ist diesbezüglich ein Kernstück. The problem of imports, be they of a contractual or legislative nature, is a crucial element in this respect. |Das vorherrschende Element ist geistiger Natur.|| | The predominant factor is of a spiritual nature. Das vorherrschende Element ist geistiger Natur. The predominant factor is of a spiritual nature. |Wenn es um wichtige Probleme keine Redezeit.|| | When it is a matter of important problems concerning nature, the environment, production, we have no speaking time. Wenn es um wichtige Probleme keine Redezeit. When it is a matter of important problems concerning nature, the environment, production, we have no speaking time. |Die technische Natur dieses Themas sollte dies ermöglichen.|| | The technical nature of this issue should make this possible. Die technische Natur dieses Themas sollte dies ermöglichen. The technical nature issue should make this possible. |Zuweilen kämpfen wir gegen die Gewalten der Natur.|| | We are sometimes struggling against the forces of nature. Zuweilen kämpfen wir gegen die Gewalten der Natur. We are sometimes struggling against the forces of nature. |Es liegt wollen.|| | It is in the nature of success that we should all wish to celebrate it. Es liegt in wollen. It is in the nature of success that we should all wish to celebrate it. |Nicht darunter fallen alle Tätigkeiten nichtwirtschaftlicher Natur und rein innerstaatliche Sachverhalte.|| | Activities not included are all those of a non-economic nature and those that are purely national. Nicht darunter fallen alle Tätigkeiten nichtwirtschaftlicher Natur und rein innerstaatliche Sachverhalte. Activities not included are all those of a non-economic nature and those that are purely national. |Denn es liegt in der Natur des Menschen, nicht das Opt-in zu wählen.|| | But of course it is human nature not to opt in to get them. Denn es liegt in der Natur des Menschen, nicht das Opt-in zu wählen. But of course it is human nature not to opt in to get them. |Das liegt in der Natur von Kompromissen.|| | All sides have had to make concessions and nobody is perfectly happy with every element of the package as is the nature of a compromise. Das liegt in der Natur von Kompromissen. All sides have had to make concessions and nobody is perfectly happy with every element of the package as is the nature of a compromise. |Nun lässt sich ist.|| | The field of science, however, by its very nature, does not lend itself to regulation, because it is generally unpredictable. Nun lässt sich der wissenschaftliche weitgehend unvorhersehbar ist. The field of science, however, by its very nature, does not lend itself to regulation, because it is generally unpredictable.
